repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Secondary Teacher
            Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Secondary Teacher Training
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory. The key
            lessons drawn from this project implementation experience
            include: 1) Coordinating agencies responsible for
            implementing key activities need to be established and
            detailed terms of reference developed prior to negotiations.
            Early establishment of agencies responsible for
            implementation is recommended. 2) Technical assistance
            support should include adequate consensus building and
            knowledge transfer. 3) To avoid delays in the implementation
            of civil works, special attention should be paid to the
            timely selection of sites, early preparation and review of
            architectural designs, especially if the contracts are large
            in value such as the Faculty of Education contracts under
            the project. 4) In the early phase of the project, Project
            Management Unit's performance was not satisfactory,
            large due to inadequately selected or trained staff. 5)
            Log-frame and monitoring and evaluation systems must be
            developed early in the project to assess both project
            progress as well as achievement of development objectives.

docna.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Secondary Teacher
            Training Project

18157720.admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa
18157720.theme: Rural services and infrastructure,Education for the knowledge economy,Gender
18157720.trustfund:
TF032903-EUROPE AND MIDDLE EAST -
            EDUCATION (EGYPT, YEMEN, JORDAN)

repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Secondary Teacher
            Training Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The overall aim of the project is to
            improve secondary school teaching while creating a basis for
            quality improvement through upgrading the cadre of teachers,
            making better use of the teacher resource and planning for
            future improvements.  The project will:  (a) provide support
            for the four-year and one-year secondary teacher training
            programs at the Faculties of Education (FOEs) at Sana'a
            and Aden; (b) start a master's program in education at
            Sana'a; (c) improve science education; (d) upgrade and
            expand FOE facilities; (e) establish an in-service training;
            and (f) improve the nationwide coordination of policy
            formulation, and of secondary teacher training.

docna.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Secondary Teacher
